description: Hezbollah’s leader called two days of deadly blasts in Lebanon this week an “act of war” by Israel. Today, on “Post Reports,” what we know about how the attacks unfolded – and whether they could escalate to all-out war.
title: Exploding pager attacks in Lebanon, and fears of a wider war

description: The attacks offer a rare window into the inner-workings of Hezbollah — an organization that is notoriously secretive and deeply embedded in Lebanese society.
title: Toll of Lebanon device attacks reveals Hezbollah’s ‘society in arms’

description: The bronze sword was unearthed by archaeologists at an ancient fort in the Nile Delta. It was emblazoned with the signature emblem of Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II.
title: Sword with pharaoh’s mark found in Egypt, still shimmering 3,000 years later

description: Thai rescue workers freed the woman, who had been washing dishes at home when she was trapped by the 13-foot python. She was bitten several times.
title: Woman spends almost two hours in 13-foot python’s coils: ‘I fought with it’

description: Twenty women accused Fayed of sexual assault, five of whom said he raped them while they worked at Harrods, the high-end London store he owned. He died in 2023.
title: Women accuse Mohamed al-Fayed, billionaire and friend of U.K. royalty, of rape

description: Lebanon is reeling from two days of deadly explosions linked to electronic devices. Hezbollah blamed Israel. Its leader, Hasan Nasrallah, is due to speak.
title: Middle East braces for Hezbollah response to Lebanon pager, radio attacks

description: Young Russians are embracing Kremlin propaganda, reshaping the Ukraine war narrative with ultranationalist views and seeing themselves as patriotic truth defenders.
title: A wartime generation of youth molded by Putin’s propaganda

description: The nonbinding resolution says Israel must end its “unlawful presence” within a year, pull out military forces, halt settlement expansion and evacuate settlers.
title: U.N. General Assembly demands Israel end occupation of Palestinian territory

description: Icom says the two-way radios apparently used in attacks across Lebanon, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 450, were discontinued a decade ago.
title: Japanese walkie-talkie maker investigating Lebanon explosion reports

description: Researchers believe the remains found in a lead coffin in 2022 are those of the French Renaissance poet Joachim du Bellay.
title: Lost for 450 years, famed poet’s grave found at Notre Dame, scientists say
